RECORD.TEXT: CTMC 25377366 260869 9/15/2001 12:00:00 AM DEHYDRATION Admission Date : 09/15/2001 Report Status : Signed Discharge Date : ADMISSION DIAGNOSIS : VOMITING . DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS : GASTRIC OUTLET OBSTRUCTION SECONDARY TO PYLORIC HYPERTROPHY . HISTORY OF PRESENTING ILLNESS : The patient is an 80-year-old woman with several months of difficulty swallowing and vomiting . The patient notes that the vomitus is usually brown like coffee grounds , although not bloody and make contain food from several days . She said that she has had no p.o. intake for about 3 days . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : ADMISSION MEDICATIONS : Lipitor 10 mg q.d. , salicylate , Reglan 10 mg q.d. , folate 1 mg q.d. , Prevacid 30 mg q.d. , methotrexate 12.5 mg weekly , Lopressor 25 mg t.i.d. , K-Dur 20 mEq daily . THE PATIENT IS ALLERGIC TO CODEINE WHICH CAUSES NAUSEA AND VOMITING . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : On admission , physical examination was revealing for a temperature of 97.5 , heart rate 102 , blood pressure 176/61 , respiratory rate 20 and saturation 95% on room air . Heart rate was regular , S1 and S2 were normal , 2/6 systolic ejection murmur at the left upper sternal border with radiation to the carotids . There was trace pedal edema on the left greater than right and tenderness of the left lateral malleolus without pain with flexion of ankle or compromise of distal pulses . LABORATORY DATA : Significant for a white count of 16.87 , hematocrit of 32.8 and platelets of 436,000 . The differential on the white count was 80% PMNs , 14% bands and 5% lymphocytes . HOSPITAL COURSE : A CAT scan of the abdomen was obtained and showed multiple small adrenal nodules with the greatest one being 0.8 cm . The pylorus was thickened without mass or lymphadenopathy . There was sigmoid diverticulosis and tortuous calcified aorta . On September 17 , 2001 , the patient had an upper endoscopy with endoscopic ultrasound . Ultrasonographic findings included an eccentric wall thickening in the region of the pylorus without focal masses or extrinsic compressions . The patient underwent balloon dilatation of the pyloric stenosis initially from 8 to 10 and then from 10 to 12 mm . Pathological findings from the biopsy revealed antral type mucosa with chronic gastritis and diffuse intestinal metaplasia without Helicobacter pylori microorganisms seen . There was no evidence of malignancy . Over the next several days , the patient 's diet was slowly advanced but she continued to vomit after taking large meals . It was ensured that she would take an adequate amount of liquids to avoid dehydration and at that point , she was discharged home in satisfactory condition with the follow up in GI clinic . DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS : Atenolol 50 mg p.o. q.d. , Colace 100 mg p.o. b.i.d. , lisinopril 10 mg p.o. q.d. , Prilosec 40 mg p.o. q.d. , prednisone 5 mg p.o. q.a.m. , Zocor 20 mg p.o. q.h.s. The patient is instructed to eat 6 small meals per day to avoid vomiting . She is encouraged to take a long time to have her meals for the same reason . She will follow up with Dr. Hearing , who is her primary care physician at Loitpeer Health , as well as with the Loitpeer Health Gastrointestinal Clinic .
